name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Minnesota research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Minnesota ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Minnesota ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Minnesota research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Minnesota research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Minnesota Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Minnesota research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Minnesota Overview—1:34

  3. Follow this research study for Minnesota ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Minnesota Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Minnesota research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Minnesota Resources

  5. Study the Ancestry State Guide for Minnesota research.

    ☆ AC—Minnesota State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  6. Record Finder: Use the Minnesota Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Minnesota Record Selection Table

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Minnesota in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Minnesota
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Minnesota Minorities

    2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Minnesota in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Minnesota
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Minnesota in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Minnesota
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Minnesota Minorities

  2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Minnesota in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Minnesota

1. Explore Minnesota historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Minnesota History

  2. Explore Minnesota history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Minnesota

    ☆ Minnesota History

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Minnesota archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Minnesota archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Minnesota archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Minnesota Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Minnesota State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Minnesota.
  3. Explore the Minnesota Historical Society collection.
  4. Explore the Minnesota Digital Library site.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Minnesota genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Minnesota research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Minnesota ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Minnesota city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Minnesota Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Minnesota city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Minnesota city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Minnesota ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Minnesota city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

  2. Find links to Minnesota newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Minnesota Online Historical Newspapers site.

  5. See additional Minnesota newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Minnesota newspaper and obituary records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Minnesota research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Minnesota County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Minnesota.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Minnesota Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Minnesota research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Minnesota Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Minnesota Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Minnesota.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Minnesota research.
  2. Explore the Minnesota research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Minnesota research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Minnesota in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Minnesota Societies

  2. Explore the Minnesota Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Minnesota Historical Society site.
  4. Explore Minnesota genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Minnesota.
